log.description: Manage my logging in your server.

help.noInclude: Do not include the `<>` when running commands.
help.main: This command consists of several subcommands.

add.invalidType: Invalid type **{0}**. Use `{0}log available` to see the valid types.
add.missingPermission: I'm missing the permission **{0}** in the channel <#{1}>.
add.done: Setup logging of **{0}** in <#{1}>. Use `{2}log remove {3}` to disable it.
add.doneAll: Setup all events in <#{0}>. You can use `{1}log clear` to disable all logging.
add.max: You may only have **{0}** log entries total. Contact a developer if you believe you need more than this, or remove some with `{1}log remove`.

remove.invalidId: An entry was not found with the id **{0}**.
remove.lessThanOne: The entry id cannot be less than one.

list.noEntries: There aren't any log entries to list.
list.lessThanOne: The page number cannot be less than one.
list.invalidPageOne: Invalid page number **{0}**, there is only one page.
list.invalidPage: Invalid page number **{0}**, there are **{1}** pages.

available.possible: These are the possible log events.
available.incomplete: If the name is __underlined__, the event is incomplete.
available.all: Encompasses all of the below events.
available.memberBan: When a server member is banned.
available.memberUnban: When a server member is unbanned
available.userKick: When a server member is kicked.
available.memberUpdate: When a server member is updated. (roles, nickname, etc)
available.messageDeleteBulk: When messages are deleted in bulk.
available.presenceUpdate: When a user changes their presence. (status, game, etc)
available.userUpdate: When a user is updated. (username, avatar, etc)
available.voiceJoin: When someone joins a voice channel.
available.voiceLeave: When someone leaves a voice channel.
available.voiceStateUpdate: When someone's voice state is updated. (deaf, mute, etc)
available.guildUpdate: When the server is updated. (name, region, icon, etc)

clear.noEntries: There are no entries to clear.
clear.confirm: Are you sure you want to remove **{0}** entries? **yes** or **no**.
clear.$: Do not translate yes or no

prefix.description: List this servers prefix, or change my prefix for this server.

help.noInclude: Do not include the `<>` when running commands.
help.main: This command consists of several subcommands.

add.done: Added the prefix **{0}**. Use `{1}prefix remove {0}` to remove it.

**{0}** is already a prefix in this server. Use `{1}prefix remove {0}` to remove it.

Tip: my mentions are included by default, and cannot be removed.

remove.invalid: This server does not have **{0}** as a prefix. You can list them with `{1}prefix list`.
remove.done: Removed the prefix **{0}**. You can still use me via **{1}**, or mentions.

reset.confirm: Are you sure you want to reset this servers prefixes? **yes** or **no**.
reset.$: Do not translate yes or no
reset.done: Reset this servers prefixes. Use **{0}** for my commands, or mention me.

reembed.invalidGuild: The message must be in this server.
reembed.invalidChannel: I couldn't find the channel that message is in (must be a text channel).
reembed.notSuppressed: Embeds are not suppressed on that message.

This command has some flags that can be utilized. Provide them as arguments to use them.

`--show-location` - Show the server's cluster id & shard id.
`--show-id` - Show the server's id.
You can also use `--show-all` to use all of them.
